elements.title: Using Tana's Supertags with Search (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Tana

Using Tana's Supertags with Search

Learn how to use Tana's supertags with live searches and create amazing workflows.

elements.title: Learn how to use Supertags in Tana (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Tana

Learn how to use Supertags in Tana

Understand the basics of how to use Tana's supertags.

elements.title: Using Tana's Live Search Feature (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Tana

Using Tana's Live Search Feature

Learn how to use Tana's live searches.

elements.title: Get oriented in Tana's UI (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Tana

Get oriented in Tana's UI

Get started with Tana by exploring its main UI and navigation features.

elements.title: Everything is a Node in Tana (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Tana

Everything is a Node in Tana

Learn how to use Tana's nodes.

elements.title: Data About Nodes - Fields and Tags in Tana (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Tana

Data About Nodes - Fields and Tags in Tana

Learn how to leverage Tana's fields and tags to record data about individual nodes.

elements.title: New Time Units for Higher Productivity (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Productivity

New Time Units for Higher Productivity

Our common measures of time never worked for me for time management. So I invented my own.

elements.title: The Input Channel Audit (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Atomic Essay: Attention Design

The Input Channel Audit

A quick How To guide for shaping your information diet

elements.title: Develop Strong Criteria for Input Triage (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Atomic Essay: Attention Design

Develop Strong Criteria for Input Triage

'How in the world. You need less Twitter in your life.' I had, again, discarded my guard rails of attention design and failed at input triage.

elements.title: The Seven Questions At The Heart Of Knowledge Ops (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Knowledge Ops

The Seven Questions At The Heart Of Knowledge Ops

Personal Knowledge Management is too restrictive – you want to think about all seven of these questions instead.

elements.title: The Grazing – Feeding Model of Information Gathering (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Knowledge Ops

The Grazing – Feeding Model of Information Gathering

On the Internet, information is limitless. The Grazing-Feeding Model of Information Gathering helps you know how you're engaging with that information.

elements.title: Sadly, Constraints Are Real (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Atomic Essay: Constraints

Sadly, Constraints Are Real

For the last 15 years I've ignored one fundamental truth: real constraints exist. Here's what I'm trying now.

elements.title: Adversarial Reading (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Algorithm of Thought

Adversarial Reading

Bullshit is everywhere, and these algorithms of thought help you do more adversarial reading.

elements.title: How to improve a process (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Atomic Essay: Productivity

How to improve a process

With taking notes as an example, let's talk about how to improve any process.

elements.title: Don't Fiddle With Your Note-Taking System (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Atomic Essay: Note-taking

Don't Fiddle With Your Note-Taking System

You should stick to one note-taking system and fiddle with it as little as possible. That's a myth.

elements.title: Get Rid of Peer Review and Academic Journals (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Peer Review

Get Rid of Peer Review and Academic Journals

Why to get rid of peer review and academic journals as we know them – and possibly what to do instead.

elements.title: You Actually Need to Context Switch (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Atomic Essay: Productivity

You Actually Need to Context Switch

Common wisdom says that you need to avoid context switching. That's only half true – sometimes you need to context switch.

elements.title: How to Context Switch Like a Pro (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Productivity

How to Context Switch Like a Pro

Context switching is unavoidable – but you can make it less costly by combining a couple of simple strategies.

elements.title: A Tale of Two Biases: How To Read The News (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Reading

A Tale of Two Biases: How To Read The News

Counter two frequent biases while reading the news: Selection Bias and Description Bias.

elements.title: How to use Roam Research for Interstitial Journaling (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Interstitial Journaling

How to use Roam Research for Interstitial Journaling

Interstitial Journaling is a great technique for minimizing context switching costs and staying productive. Here's how I use it in Roam Reserch.

elements.title: Why You Should Pick Zotero As A Reference Manager (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Academic Workflow

Why You Should Pick Zotero As A Reference Manager

A guide to reference managers, what you should expect from them and why Zotero is the reference manager you should use - whether you're in academia or not.

elements.title: Behavior First, Theory Second (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Learning

Behavior First, Theory Second

Behavior and Theory are two heuristics that can help you in deciding between courses and teachers.

elements.title: True Algorithms of Thought Have Arrived (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Algorithm of Thought

True Algorithms of Thought Have Arrived

Can you imagine being able to transfer 'mental software' between people? It's now possible, by using Algorithms of Thought in Roam Research.

elements.title: The Power of Keystone Habits with Roam Research (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Programming Attention

The Power of Keystone Habits with Roam Research

How to use Roam Research as your keystone habit to regularly revisit writing that is important to you, using the ∆ feature in Roam.

elements.title: Zotero and Roam Research (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Academic Workflow

Zotero and Roam Research

A guide for using Roam Research together with Zotero to get the most out of your citation metadata.

elements.title: A short (preliminary) guide to Spaced Repetition in Roam Research (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Spaced Repetition

A short (preliminary) guide to Spaced Repetition in Roam Research

How to use Roam Research's new Delta feature to do Spaced Repetition and never forget anything again.

elements.title: My grandfather's research technique - Index, Proto-Zettelkasten, Paper (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Zettelkasten

My grandfather's research technique - Index, Proto-Zettelkasten, Paper

My grandfather's way of doing history research before the computer age. Using paper and a meticulous process, he built something close to a Zettelkasten.

elements.title: How to cure Highlight Dementia (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Reading

How to cure Highlight Dementia

How to make sure that you never lose insights when reading and highlighting. Because Highlight Dementia is completely preventable.

elements.title: Actor's Concepts and Inventing Discovery (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Reading

Actor's Concepts and Inventing Discovery

How discovery became an actor's concept - and what you can use that for. Can you play chess without knowing that you are doing so?

elements.title: Getting Started with Algorithms of Thought (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Reading

Getting Started with Algorithms of Thought

An introduction to Algorithms of Thought - how they differ from Mental Models and how to use them in Roam Research.

elements.title: Universal-X - Of Polymaths and other fantastic creatures (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Polymathy

Universal-X - Of Polymaths and other fantastic creatures

There are words you can't use to describe yourself without sounding like an utter ass. Imagine asking someone at a party who they are and they respond with 'Nice to meet you, I'm a brilliant photographer/physicist/writer' - instant, life-long friends you'll be, no?

elements.title: The Right to Disagree (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Algorithm of Thought

The Right to Disagree

Contrary to popular belief, you can't just disagree with someone because you feel like it. You have to __earn__ the right to disagree with someone's position.

elements.title: A Gruvbox Theme for Roam Research (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Roam Research

A Gruvbox Theme for Roam Research

How to create a Gruvbox-style color theme for Roam Research using Roam's built-in CSS capabilities.

elements.title: Ovarian cancer mutational processes drive site-specific immune evasion (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Ovarian cancer mutational processes drive site-specific immune evasion

Multi-modal analysis of genomically unstable ovarian tumours characterizes the contribution of anatomical sites and mutational processes to evolutionary phenotypic divergence and immune resistance mechanisms.

  • Ignacio Vázquez-García
  • Florian Uhlitz
  • Sohrab P. Shah
Article Open Access 14 Dec 2022

elements.title: A male germ-cell-specific ribosome controls male fertility (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
A male germ-cell-specific ribosome controls male fertility

RibosomeST—a ribosome with a specialized nascent polypeptide exit tunnel—cotranslationally regulates the folding of a subset of male germ-cell-specific proteins that are essential for the formation of sperm.

  • Huiling Li
  • Yangao Huo
  • Jiahao Sha
Article 14 Dec 2022

elements.title: Disorder-assisted assembly of strongly correlated fluids of light (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Disorder-assisted assembly of strongly correlated fluids of light

Using particle-by-particle assembly and adiabatic manipulation of disorder, low-entropy, strongly correlated quantum fluids of light are constructed, opening up new possibilities for the preparation of exotic phases of synthetic matter.

  • Brendan Saxberg
  • Andrei Vrajitoarea
  • David I. Schuster
Article 14 Dec 2022

elements.title: Recurrent repeat expansions in human cancer genomes (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Recurrent repeat expansions in human cancer genomes

An atlas explores the landscape of recurrent repeat expansions in human cancer genomes.

  • Graham S. Erwin
  • Gamze Gürsoy
  • Michael P. Snyder
Article Open Access 14 Dec 2022

elements.title: NLR surveillance of pathogen interference with hormone receptors induces immunity (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
NLR surveillance of pathogen interference with hormone receptors induces immunity

The tomato spotted wilt orthotospovirus nonstructural protein NSs interferes with phytohormone signalling in plants to compromise plant defences by interacting with plant TCP21—this effect of the viral protein is counteracted by the plant NLR immune receptor protein Tsw.

  • Jing Chen
  • Yanxiao Zhao
  • Xiaorong Tao
Article 14 Dec 2022

elements.title: The WHO estimates of excess mortality associated with the COVID-19 pandemic (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
The WHO estimates of excess mortality associated with the COVID-19 pandemic

Msemburi et al. describe how the World Health Organization has estimated the excess mortality associated with the COVID-19 pandemic, by month and for 2020 and 2021, and analyse their estimates across the WHO member states, with 14.83 million global excess deaths estimated.

  • William Msemburi
  • Ariel Karlinsky
  • Jon Wakefield
Analysis Open Access 14 Dec 2022

elements.title: Periodic inhibition of Erk activity drives sequential somite segmentation (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Periodic inhibition of Erk activity drives sequential somite segmentation

The zebrafish segmentation clock drives sequential segmentation of somites by periodically lowering double-phosphorylated Erk and therefore projecting its oscillation on the double-phosphorylated Erk gradient.

  • M. Fethullah Simsek
  • Angad Singh Chandel
  • Ertuğrul M. Özbudak
Article 14 Dec 2022

elements.title: Wetland emission and atmospheric sink changes explain methane growth in 2020 (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Wetland emission and atmospheric sink changes explain methane growth in 2020

Using both bottom-up and top-down approaches, the record high increase in the methane growth rate in 2020 is attributed mainly to emissions from wetlands, which have been exacerbated by a warmer and wetter climate, and to the reduced atmospheric methane sink, in response to emissions reduction of air pollutants during COVID-19 lockdowns.

  • Shushi Peng
  • Xin Lin
  • Philippe Ciais
Article 14 Dec 2022

elements.title: Microglia regulate central nervous system myelin growth and integrity (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Microglia regulate central nervous system myelin growth and integrity

Resident microglia in the central nervous system are identified as the specific macrophage population that regulates myelin growth and integrity.

  • Niamh B. McNamara
  • David A. D. Munro
  • Veronique E. Miron
Article Open Access 14 Dec 2022

elements.title: Enantioselective sensing by collective circular dichroism (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Enantioselective sensing by collective circular dichroism

An array of 2D crystals of isotropic, 432-symmetric chiral gold nanoparticles is shown to exhibit collective resonances with a strong and uniform chiral near field, allowing enantioselective detection by the collective circular dichroism.

  • Ryeong Myeong Kim
  • Ji-Hyeok Huh
  • Ki Tae Nam
Article 14 Dec 2022

elements.title: Autonomous rhythmic activity in glioma networks drives brain tumour growth (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Autonomous rhythmic activity in glioma networks drives brain tumour growth

A population of highly interconnected cells in glioblastoma makes these tumours resistant to general damage but vulnerable to targeted disruption of this small fraction of cells and their rhythmic Ca2+ oscillations.

  • David Hausmann
  • Dirk C. Hoffmann
  • Frank Winkler
Article 14 Dec 2022

elements.title: A microbiome-dependent gut–brain pathway regulates motivation for exercise (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
A microbiome-dependent gut–brain pathway regulates motivation for exercise

It is demonstrated that the brain circuitry involved in regulating the motivation for physical activity is not strictly central nervous system autonomous but is shaped by peripheral influences that originate in the intestinal microbial community.

  • Lenka Dohnalová
  • Patrick Lundgren
  • Christoph A. Thaiss
Article 14 Dec 2022

elements.title: Logged tropical forests have amplified and diverse ecosystem energetics (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Logged tropical forests have amplified and diverse ecosystem energetics

Logged forests in Borneo have higher energy flow from vegetation to and broad range of bird and mammal species relative to old-growth forests and oil palm plantations, showing that they can be diverse and ecologically vibrant ecosystems.

  • Yadvinder Malhi
  • Terhi Riutta
  • Matthew J. Struebig
Article Open Access 14 Dec 2022

elements.title: Structural insights into the mechanism of the sodium/iodide symporter (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Structural insights into the mechanism of the sodium/iodide symporter

Mutations in the sodium/iodide symporter (NIS) cause congenital hypothyroidism, and our results yield insights into how NIS selects, couples and translocates anions, thereby establishing a framework for understanding NIS function.

  • Silvia Ravera
  • Juan Pablo Nicola
  • Nancy Carrasco
Article 14 Dec 2022

elements.title: SARS-CoV-2 infection and persistence in the human body and brain at autopsy (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
SARS-CoV-2 infection and persistence in the human body and brain at autopsy

A study reports the distribution, replication and persistence of SARS-CoV-2 throughout the human body including in the brain at autopsy from acute infection to more than seven months following symptom onset.

  • Sydney R. Stein
  • Sabrina C. Ramelli
  • Daniel S. Chertow
Article 14 Dec 2022

elements.title: Majorana-like Coulomb spectroscopy in the absence of zero-bias peaks (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Majorana-like Coulomb spectroscopy in the absence of zero-bias peaks

Valentini et al. devise a method through which they can perform both tunnelling spectroscopy and Coulomb blockade spectroscopy on the same hybrid nanowire island to reduce ambiguities in the detection of Majorana.

  • Marco Valentini
  • Maksim Borovkov
  • Georgios Katsaros
Article 14 Dec 2022

elements.title: Primate gastrulation and early organogenesis at single-cell resolution (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Primate gastrulation and early organogenesis at single-cell resolution

In-depth transcriptomic analyses of 56,636 single cells from monkey embryos revealed transcriptional features of major perigastrulation cell types, and comparative analyses with mouse embryos and human embryoids uncovered conserved and divergent features of perigastrulation development across species.

  • Jinglei Zhai
  • Jing Guo
  • Hongmei Wang
Article Open Access 14 Dec 2022

elements.title: Cortical–hippocampal coupling during manifold exploration in motor cortex (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Cortical–hippocampal coupling during manifold exploration in motor cortex

A new study explores the activity dialogue between hippocampus and cortex as neuronal representations of learning or adaptation are consolidated.

  • Jaekyung Kim
  • Abhilasha Joshi
  • Karunesh Ganguly
Article Open Access 14 Dec 2022

elements.title: Active eosinophils regulate host defense and immune responses in colitis (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Active eosinophils regulate host defense and immune responses in colitis

  • Alessandra Gurtner
  • Costanza Borrelli
  • Isabelle C. Arnold
Article 12 Dec 2022

elements.title: Programming Multicellular Assembly with Synthetic Cell Adhesion Molecules (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Programming Multicellular Assembly with Synthetic Cell Adhesion Molecules

  • Adam J. Stevens
  • Andrew R. Harris
  • Wendell A. Lim
Article 12 Dec 2022
